data.title: Riddley Walker, First Edition
data.meta_description: RIDDLEY WALKER by HOBAN, RUSSELL and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. 1st Printing of 1st Edition. Unclipped dust jacket, protected by mylar cover, is clean and bright with tear at bottom of spine and creasing on front flap. Pages are clean and unmarked with no rips or creases. Binding tight. Green boards, with gilt-stamped titles on blue cloth spine, are clean and sturdy with discoloration at bottom of spine. Quick, secure shipping with free delivery confirmation from Los Angeles bookstore. Photos available upon request.

Hard Cover. Condition: VG. Dust Jacket Condition: VG. First Edition. First UK printing, jacket design by Mon Mohan. Light soil to outer edges, corner creasing (from an external bump), light tanning to paper and light creasing from page handling. Boards have light edge wear and light bump wear. DJ has edge/rub wear, light soiling, light creasing and the spine text has faded. Actual book for sale pictured. 14.5 x 22.4 x 2.5cm, wt600g One of the titles selected by Anthony Burgess for his book "99 Novels: The Best in English Since 1939". B4 nd u upon the berning bye bye hump u gotta reed this buk. Trubba not no kidda no Arga Warga! Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

First U.S. edition and first printing. Hardcover. 220 pages. An acclaimed science fiction book that won the John W. Campbell Memorial Award for Best Science Fiction Novel. A clean and tight very near fine copy in paper covered boards with a cloth spine and in a near fine dust jacket with a crease to the front flap. A very nice copy of this modern classic.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. First Edition, Third Printing (Full Number Line). Not price-clipped ($13.95 price intact). Published by Summit Books, 1980. Octavo. Dark blue cloth over green boards stamped in gold. Book is very good; clean with no writing or names. Sharp corners and spine straight. Binding tight and pages crisp. Previous owner name on flyleaf and stamp on bottom page ends. Dust jacket is very good with light shelf wear, large tear on front cover and nicks. 220 pages. ISBN: 0671421476. 100% positive feedback. 30 day money back guarantee. NEXT DAY SHIPPING! Excellent customer service. Please email with any questions or if you would like a photo. All books packed carefully and ship with free delivery confirmation/tracking. All books come with free bookmarks. Ships from Southampton, New York.

HARDCOVER. Condition: F/VG+. FIRST EDITION. WINNER OF THE 1981 JOHN W. CAMPBELL AWARD BOOK IS FINE WITHOUT ANY MARKS TO THE BINDING OR THE TEXT EXPECT FOR A REMAINDER MARK TO TEXT BLOCK BOTTOM EDGE. D.J. HAS A COUPLE OF SHORT TEARS AT BASE OF FRONT PANEL, A TRACE OF RUB AT QUARTER BOUND JUNCTURE ON THE REAR PANEL, BUT IS OTHERWISE FINE AND IS NOT PRICE-CLIPPED. AN EXCELLENT CLEAN, BRIGHT, UNFADED COPY WITH NO REMAINDER MARK.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First Edition/First Printing with the complete number line; A Near Fine book in a Near Fine price clipped dust jacket, with only light shelf wear to the board and panel edges, else F/F. An outstanding copy of this remarkable book, winner of the Campbell Award and nominated for the Nebula Award. Also included, a F/F copy of Hoban's "Pilgermann", another critically acclaimed work from this author. Neither book remaindered or ex-library; in a protective Mylar cover and will ship in a sturdy box.

Soft cover. Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First Washington Square Press edition, 1st printing, June 1982. Bright, clean & tight paperback, unread, in FINE condition. "Set in a remote future and composed in an English nobody ever spoke or wrote---lighting by El Greco and jokes by Punch and Judy---and a hero with Huck Finn's heart and charm."---The New York Times. "Critics have compared RIDDLEY WALKER to Huckleberry Finn, A Clockwork Orange, Lord of the Flies and the books of Tolkien. It is none of these. It is unique. Yet it is surely destined to join their company." [] "Marvelous---a novel people will be reading for a long, long time."---The Washington Post Book World. "An artistic tour-de-force in every possible way."---New York Review of Books. "A remarkable book, which imprisoned me in its atmosphere and wouldn't let me get out."---Anthony Burgess. Nominated for the Nebula Award for Best Novel in 1981. A National Book Critics Circle Award Nominee. Winner of the John W. Campbell Memorial Award for best science fiction novel in 1982, & Australian Science Fiction Achievement Award in 1983. Pristine paperback, clean & unmarked, w/sharp corners & crisp edges that show slight uniform foxing, a square & tight binding w/no creases in spine. Collectible & quite presentable for a 40-year-old paperback.

FIRST EDITION. Half title. Orig. black cloth. Red, white & black printed d.w., clipped. A lovely bright copy. Hoban's novel of a post-apocalyptic Kent, set 2,000 years after a nuclear war, sees iron-age level societies fighting for scraps of knowledge, technology, and language. What survives of culture is a bizarre (but utterly believable) melange of Punch and Judy shows, the life of St Eustace, and nuclear myth. Written in a weird Chaucerian English drawn from his experiences as a teacher in Kent and his childhood in suburban Pennsylvania, Hoban alleged that it destroyed his ability to spell - words are mangled, degraded, and re-formed. An astonishing feat of imagination. Anthony Burgess said that while it 'could not expect to be popular. it seems to me a permanent contribution to literature'.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+. No Jacket. First Edition Thus. First Easton Press edition, hardcover in full red leather with all edges gilt, and gold stamped decoration to the spine and covers. This special collector's edition is signed by Hoban on the limitation page, and is accompanied by the publisher's certificate of authenticity and notes sheet. The book has a shallow skew to the binding, and mild bumps to the spine ends. Otherwise, this is a solid, tight, clean Very Good+ copy.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. Easton Press. SIGNED. Red cloth with 4 raised spine bands on spine and decorations stamped in gilt on the front cover. Book accented in 22kt gold. Printed on archival paper with gilded edges. The end sheets are of moire fabric with a silk ribbon page marker. Smyth sewing and concealed muslin joints to ensure the highest quality binding. This book is in full leather with hubbed spines. Boldly signed by the author on a special dedication page tipped in by the publisher. There is a COA as well as an information card about the book loosely laid in. Absolutely gorgeous copy which appears unread! Selling quality books for 35 years!. Signed by Author(s).

First edition with Quentin Blake illustrations. Signed limited edition. Publisher's cloth with wraparound Quentin Blake illustration, metallic titles to the spine, in the original slipcase. Illustrated in colour throughout. A fine copy, the binding square and tight, the contents clean throughout and without previous owner's inscriptions or stamps. Housed in the fine original slipcase. A superb example of this wonderfully illustrated edition of Russell Hoban's award winning dystopian novel. Limited edition of 1000 copies of which this example is hand numbered 439 and signed by Quentin Blake in black ink on the limitation page. Further details and images for any of the items listed are available on request. Lucius Books welcomes direct contact with our customers.

Hardcover. Condition: Like New. No Jacket. Quentin Blake (illustrator). 1st Edition (Thus). Please email for Photographs or further information. Like New - Fine book in fine slipcase. Unread, as new. Beautiful Please see photos as part of condition report 2017 1st Edition (Thus) , Slipcase RIDDLEY WALKER By Russell Hoban Russell Conwell Hoban (February 4, 1925 ? December 13, 2011) was an American expatriate writer. His works span many genres, including fantasy, science fiction, mainstream fiction, magical realism, poetry, and children's books. He lived in London from 1969 until his death. Illustrated By: Quentin Blake Format: Hardcover, Language: English Dust Jacket: No Jacket, Dust Jacket Condition: No Jacket Published By: Folio Society, London folio (fo 12 × 19 305 × 483),Pages 279 ISBN: This edition of Riddley Walker has been typeset in poliphilus and blado types at the Folio Society. The Illustrations have been reproduced by TAG International. It has been printed by Kosel, Krugzell, Germany on woodstock betulla paper and bound by them in Diuchesse offset cloth printed with a design by Quentin Blake. It is limited to 1000 copies, signed and numbered by the artist and 20 lettered copies which are not for sale. Postscript by Dr Rowan Williams, former Archbishop of Canterbury. Riddley Walker is Russell Hoban s genre-defying masterpiece set in post-apocalyptic Kent, in an England in the grip of a second Iron Age, and written in 'Riddleyspeak' a fractured phonetic version of English. This limited edition combines the extraordinary text with large-scale illustrations by Quentin Blake. SKU: BTETM0002019 Approximate Package Dimensions H: 20, L: 35, W: 30 (Units: cm), W: 3Kg. Signed by Illustrator(s).
